result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Derrick John White

records.addlTxt: Maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with A.L.K., R.J.V.S. or Motel 6 in Hartford. Not possess/consume any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick John White appeared by video, in custody at Ozaukee Co. Jail.  Attorney Robert Buckett appeared by video for Derrick John White.  (22CF5; Ozaukee Co. 22CF170)  Defendant waives right to appear in person.  Atty. Buckett states the cases were stalled based on crime lab results in 22CF5 and defendant is requesting to resolve the cases.  State advises is still awaiting results of the testing.  Court dismissed case for read-in upon plea to 22CF5.  Court cancels the warrant and bail forfeiture and cash bond reinstated.  C

Hearing on July 26, 2022 at 11:00 am.
Confirmed Zoom with Ozaukee Co. Jail, mailed D's NOH to Oz. Co. Jail.
Cash bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of $500.00

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Mandy A. Schepper in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick John White not in court.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Derrick John White.  (22CF5; Ozaukee Co. 22CF170)  Case called at 8:34 a.m.  Atty. Buckett states the defendant is in holding at the Ozaukee Co. jail awaiting clearing the Ozaukee Co. warrant and has sent a picture that reflects the inside of Ozaukee Co. jail.
Reset Hearing from 5-12-2022 to on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am due to conflict by counsel.
22R 007088; Bond received at Sheriff's Department per Receipt #14863 on  4/8/22

Clerk: EZ. Prosecuting attorney Matthew Vincent Nugent in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Derrick John White in court, in custody.  Attorney Robert Buckett in court for Derrick John White.  (22CF5)  Atty. Buckett states the defendant believes he will be able to post bond and request adjournment for test results in 22CF5.
Hearing scheduled for May 12, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Prosecuting attorney Jeanette Kara Corbett appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Derrick John White appeared in court, in custody, Attorney Robert Buckett appeared in court for Derrick John White. Clerk: EZ. (22CF5)  Defendant waives reading of the Information.  Not guilty plea entered.
Hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 08:15 am.

Prosecuting attorney Mark David Bensen appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Derrick John White appeared in court, Attorney Robert Buckett appeared in court for Derrick John White. Counsel's first appearance.  Preliminary hearing waived.  Court binds defendant over for trial and State shall file an Information.
Arraignment scheduled for March 2, 2022 at 09:45 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety. No contact with A.L.K. or R.J.V.S. or Motel 6 in Hartford. Not possess/consume any controlled substance without valid prescription.

Prosecuting attorney Stephanie L Hanson appeared in court for the State of Wisconsin, Defendant Derrick John White appeared by zoom video, in custody at Washington County Jail, Attorney Andrew D Leech appeared in court for Derrick John White. Clerk: EZ. (22CF5)Def given complaint, advised of charges, penalties and rights, and probable cause found.  Defendant eligible for State Public Defender.  State requests $500.00 cash bond.  Atty. Leech requests lower cash bond or signature bond.  Preliminary hearing time limits waived. Adjourned for position on preliminary hearing.
Hearing scheduled for January 31, 2022 at 09:45 am.
